decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: CRAVING SATISFIED

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and chop them. Set aside.
In another bowl, add unsalted butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar and vanilla essence. Whisk well.
Add milk and whisk again. Add AP Flour, baking soda and baking powder. Fold until well combined.
Add the chopped Oreo Cookies, vinegar and white choco chips. Mix until well combined.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Grease a muffin tin with non-stick spray or line with muffin/cupcake liners. Scoop out 1 tablespoon of the mixture and press it into the bottom of the cupcake mould. Cover the bottom completely. Top with an Oreo Cookie.
Scoop out a second tablespoon of the mixture into the mould and press. This layer should completely cover up the Oreo Cookie. Repeat with the remaining mixture and cookies.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until the cupcakes are golden brown and puffy and the edges have started setting. Allow the cupcake to cool.
For the frosting: Take a bowl. Add the unsalted butter, confectioners' sugar, vanilla extract and whipping cream. Whisk the mixture. Keep whisking until it becomes smooth and fluffy.
Pour the prepared vanilla buttercream into a piping bag. Attach the ateco tip and then swirl the frosting on top of each cupcake.
For the decoration, put Oreo Cookies on top of each cupcake and then sprinkle on some crushed Oreo Cookies.
If desired, you can even pour some chocolate sauce on top.

The cupcakes can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. You could freeze them as well. Allow them to come to room temperature before serving due to the high amount of butter in the frosting. Freeze the frosting in an airtight container or a ziploc bag before pouring it on the cupcake. Add it only once the cupcakes have defrosted.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: LAYERS OF JOY

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and crush them into pieces. Set aside.
Take a saucepan. Add sugar, corn starch and agar agar powder. Mix well.
Add milk. Whisk until well combined. Boil the mixture for 5-6 mins until it thickens. Remove the pan from the stove.
Add butter and vanilla essence. Whisk well.
Divide the mixture into two parts. Take the first part and add strawberry essence and pink food colour to it. Mix well.
Take a cup. Fill half of it with the strawberry mixture. Refrigerate for 1 hour and let it set.
Take a bowl. Add Cadbury Cocoa Powder and water. Mix well.
Now, take the second part of the milk mixture. Add it to the chocolate mixture. Mix well. Set aside once done.
Take out the strawberry mixture from the refrigerator and add the crushed Oreo Cookies to it.
Pour the chocolate mixture over it. Refrigerate for 1 hour and let it set.
Take out the cup once the chocolate mixture has set. Turn it upside down on a plate and demould it.
For the decoration, dust some Cadbury Cocoa Powder over it and place an Oreo Cookie on top!
Oreo Pudding is Ready!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: CHOCOLATEY, CREAMY, CHEESY

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and crush them. Add melted butter, milk, brown sugar and vanilla essence. Whisk until well combined.
Take a sieve and sift in the AP Flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Fold until well combined.
Transfer the mixture into a piping bag. Pipe the batter into the prepared donut pan.
Bake at 170C for about 10 minutes or until the doughnuts bounce back when lightly pressed. Make sure you don't overbake!
Allow the doughnuts to cool for a few minutes before taking them out of the pan, then place them onto a wire rack and let them cool completely.
For the Cream Cheese Frosting: Take a bowl. Add the cream cheese,melted butter, confectioners' sugar, vanilla essence and milk. Beat the mixture for about 2 minutes.
Transfer the frosting into a piping bag and spread it on top of each donut. Sprinkle a few teaspoons of chopped Oreo Cookies on top.
Serve at once! Donuts are best eaten the day they are made.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: DIVINE, DELICIOUS, DELECTABLE

steps.instructions: To make the crust: Add the Oreo Cookies to a food processor and mix until you have fine crumbs. Scoop out the crumbs into a mixing bowl.
Add melted butter. Mix until the crumbs are moist. Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper.
Transfer the mixture into the pan and firmly press it down until it becomes even. Refrigerate for 15 minutes.
To make the cheesecake: Take a large bowl. Add the whipping cream and sugar. Beat the ingredients until the batter is of a smooth consistency.
Add the cream cheese and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined. Fold in the crushed Oreo Cookies.
Spread the cheesecake filling on the crust and layer it evenly. Refrigerate for 2 hours.
For the topping: Take another bowl. Add whipped cream and crushed Oreo Cookies. Transfer it into a piping bag.
Pipe the Oreo cream on the cake. Add Oreo Cookies.
Add a pinch of powdered Oreo Cookies.
Pour chocolate sauce and enjoy!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: PARIS IN A BITE

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and chop them.
Add fresh cream and mix thoroughly. Set aside.
Take a puff pastry sheet and dust with flour. Roll gently.

Cut out the uneven edges and then cut the sheet into triangles. Take the first triangle, put Oreo Cream mixture on the broader edge and roll it up towards the narrow side. Repeat for the other triangles as well.
Transfer these to the pre-greased tin.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Once done, brush butter on top and sprinkle the crushed Oreo Cookies.
Oreo croissants are ready!

name: Oreo Ice Cream Tart | Desserts Corner
title: Oreo Ice * Cream Tart

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: CHILLED TREAT OF THE DAY

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and crush them.
Pour the melted salted butter on top. Fold gently until well combined.
Transfer the Oreo butter mix to a tart tin and spread until even. Freeze for 30 minutes.
Once done, take out the tart. For the filling, add scoops of Cookies and Cream Ice Cream, drizzle the chocolate sauce and melted white chocolate and press until it becomes flat.
Sprinkle the chopped Oreo Cookies on top.
Drizzle some more melted white chocolate and chocolate sauce and done! Cut into slices and serve away.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: HAPPINESS IN A BITE

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and chop them. Set aside.
In another bowl, whisk curd and powdered sugar.
Add the refined oil. Whisk well.
Add refined flour, baking powder and vanilla essence. Mix well.
Add half the milk and fold gently.
Add in the chopped Oreo Cookies and the remaining milk. Fold again.
Scoop out the batter into the muffin cups. The batter should fill up 3/4th of the cup.
Top it up with chopped Oreo cookies and marshmallow.
Preheat oven to 180C. Bake for 15-17 mins.
Drizzle chocolate sauce on top.
Demould the cupcakes. Ready to serve!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: ROLLED WITH LOVE

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the Oreo Cookies and crush them until they turn into fine powder. Set aside.
In another bowl, add hung curd, powdered Oreo Cookies and sugar. Whisk well.
Add whipped cream and mix well. Set aside once done.

Take another bowl. Add AP flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, powdered Oreo Cookies, a pinch of salt and a pinch of cinnamon powder. Pour oil, vinegar and water (as required). Mix thoroughly and then knead the dough.
Make small circular portions out of the dough. Put some flour on the board and roll the portion into thin sheets.
Cut out circular rings and wrap around an aluminium tube.
Roll it thoroughly so the sheets stick nicely. Dock holes using a fork.
Deep fry these until they are crisp. Remove the aluminium tube once cooled down.
Pipe the prepared filling inside the roll.
Put pieces of Oreo Cookies on the sides.
Sprinkle icing sugar on top. Oreo Rolls are ready!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: So yummy, so light, so easy

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cocoa Powder, whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, jaggery powder and oil.
Sift all the dry ingredients in one bowl and set aside.
Grease and line an 8 inch round pan with parchment paper and set aside.
Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Choco Chips, yogurt, oil, milk, sliced almonds and vanilla extract.
Mix the yogurt, oil, milk and vanilla extract in another bowl.
Add this to the sifted dry ingredients. Mix until the batter is lump free.
Add Cadbury Choco Chips. Mix well.
Pour the batter into the cake pan.
Generously sprinkle the sliced almonds on the batter.
Preheat the oven to 180C.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a skewer or toothpick inserted in it comes out clean.
Allow it to cool. Your cake is ready!

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For  the Guilt Free Choco Cake

name: Eggless Strawberry Chocolate Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Eggless Strawberry * Chocolate Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: PERFECT TREAT FOR THE WINTER FEAST

steps.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees for 15 minutes. Take a small bowl. Add 1 cup of room temperature milk and lime juice to it. Mix well and then leave for 5 minutes for the milk to curdle.
In another bowl, add AP flour (remove 2 tbsp worth from the bowl), Cadbury Cocoa Powder, baking powder and baking soda.
Take a mixing bowl. Add oil, 1/3rd cup milk, vanilla essence and powdered sugar. Add the curdled milk. Tip: The milk should be mildly curdled, else it will take on a solid form. Mix well.
Now, gradually add the dry mixture into the wet mixture. Tip: Always mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients gradually, so that the mixture doesn't form lumps.
Grease and line two 4-inch round shape cake tins (or 1 tin of 6 inches) with butter paper. Pour the mixture into the cake tins.
Place them in the preheated oven and bake for 25 minutes. Alternatively, if the cakes are being baked on a stove, bake for 30-35 minutes.
For the buttercream frosting: Take a bowl. Add salted butter, icing sugar, milk and Cadbury Cocoa powder. Gently mix until it is well-combined.

Place the cake onto a plate. Place the plate on a turntable. Put a knife in the middle of the cake and turn the turntable around. First, cut it from the sides and then from the centre. Keep the upper part of the cake in the plate upside down. Brush some water/sugar syrup on it. Pipe a layer of chocolate buttercream on the cake and flatten it.

Cover the sides and the top of the cake with the chocolate buttercream. In between the 2 layers, there will be a layer of chocolate buttercream frosting and crushed strawberries. Keep it in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
To make the chocolate ganache, mix the dark chocolate and fresh cream. Using the chocolate drip effect, pipe the ganache onto the cake.
Decorate the cake with chocolate buttercream and strawberries and sprinkle icing sugar on top to give the cake a winter theme. Our winter-themed Eggless Strawberry Chocolate Cake is ready!

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Eggless Strawberry Chocolate Cake

name: Chocolate Orange Spice Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Chocolate Orange * Spice Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Taste the Christmas spirit in every bite!

steps.instructions: Take a large bowl. Add Cadbury Cocoa Powder and sugar. Whisk until well combined. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 180C. Lightly grease and line a 6-inch baking tin and set aside.
Add the oil, buttermilk, cinnamon powder, orange zest, baking soda, baking powder and AP flour. Mix the ingredients until the batter is of a smooth consistency.
Transfer the batter to the prepared tin.

Bake for 45 minutes to an hour at 180C. After 30 minutes of baking, tent the cake with a sheet of foil to prevent the top from browning. Let it bake until it becomes firm and a tester inserted in it comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool in the tin for 15 minutes, then place it onto a wire rack and let it cool completely. Level the top of the cake, if required.
Take a large bowl. Add the whipping cream, icing sugar, cinnamon powder and orange extract.
Whisk the mixture with an electric hand blender until it forms medium-stiff peaks.
Spread the frosting on the top and sides of the cake.
Decorate with cinnamon orange cookies and candied orange slices.

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Chocolate Orange Spice Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: LOOKS GOOD, TASTES EVEN BETTER

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cocoa Powder, sugar, vanilla extract, buttermilk, baking powder, salt, baking soda, oil, AP flour, water and coffee powder.
Grease and line a 5 inch cake pan with butter paper/parchment paper. Set aside.
Whisk the sugar, oil, buttermilk and vanilla extract in a bowl. Keep whisking until the sugar melts completely.

Place a sieve over the bowl and add AP flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, baking powder, baking soda, salt and coffee powder to the mixture. Ensure that there are no lumps in the mixture. Now, using the cut and fold method, mix the batter.
Add the water in two rounds. Whisk well. Ensure the batter is of smooth consistency. Add more water, if required.
Pour the batter into the cake pan. Set aside.
Add salt to the pressure cooker and close the lid. Remove the gasket and whistle from the lid. Heat for 5 to 10 minutes. This creates a preheated oven atmosphere or dry heat.
Place a stand and put the cake pan inside the preheated cooker. Cover and cook on medium flame for 45 minutes.
Insert a toothpick in the cake. If it comes out clean, the cake is baked. Let the cake cool and then gently take it out of the mould.
Measure the ingredients for frosting: Cadbury Cocoa Powder and whipping cream.
Whisk the whipping cream and Cadbury Cocoa Powder using an electric whisk.
Spread a layer of the cream on the cake.
Dust with Cadbury Cocoa Powder. Done!

name: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Cadbury Pull * Me Up Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: THE SWEET FINISH YOU NEED TODAY

steps.instructions: Measure the dry ingredients: AP flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, caster sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 1

steps.instructions: Sift all the dry ingredients in one bowl. Mix well and set aside.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 2

steps.instructions: Grease and line two 6-inch round pans with parchment paper. Preheat oven to 180C.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 3

steps.instructions: Measure the wet ingredients: coffee water, vegetable oil, vinegar and vanilla extract.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 4

steps.instructions: Add the wet ingredients to the dry mixture and whisk until incorporated.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 5

steps.instructions: Pour the batter into the prepared pans.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 6

steps.instructions: Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the cakes comes out clean. Allow the cakes to cool for 5-10 minutes before taking them out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 7

steps.instructions: Trim off the top of the cakes if they are domed.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 8

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for the ganache: Cadbury Darkmilk, whipping cream and warm fresh cream.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 9

steps.instructions: Whip the cream until it forms stiff peaks.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 10

steps.instructions: Pour the warm fresh cream over the chopped Cadbury Darkmilk and let it sit for 5-10 minutes. Stir gently until it is well combined. Let it cool down.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 11

steps.instructions: Place a cake board on the turntable. Place one cake on it. Spread some of the whipped cream on the cake.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 12

steps.instructions: Place the other cake and then cover the sides of the cake with a transparent acetate sheet. Stick the sheet on the cake with transparent tape.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 13

steps.instructions: Pour the ganache on top of the cake. Decorate with edible pearls.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 14

steps.instructions: Plate the cake before pulling the acetate sheet out.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 15

steps.instructions: Pull out the acetate sheet. Done!

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Pull Me Up Cake Step 16

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Cadbury pull me up cake

name: Black Forest Birthday Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Black Forest * Birthday Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: PERFECT TREAT FOR THE BIRTHDAY FEAST

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cocoa Powder, AP flour, baking soda, caster sugar and salt.
Mix the ingredients in one bowl and set aside.
Grease and line two 6-inch round pans with parchment paper. Preheat oven to 180C.
Measure the ingredients: vegetable oil, coffee water, vanilla extract and vinegar.
Add these ingredients to the dry mixture and whisk until incorporated.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans. Bake for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the cakes comes out clean.
Allow the cakes to cool for 5-10 minutes before taking them out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack.
Trim off the top of the cakes if they are domed. Cut each cake horizontally, into two parts, if desired.
Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cooking Block Dark shavings, cherries and whipping cream.
Whip the cream until it forms stiff peaks.
Place a cake board on the turntable. Place one cake on it. Spread some cream on the cake and add a few cherries. Repeat with the other layer/s.
Place the last layer and spread more cream on its sides and top. Smoothen using a palette knife.
Gently place the Cadbury Cooking Block Dark shavings on the sides of the cake.
Decorate the cake in the manner you desire with more cream and cherries on top. Cool the cake for 30 minutes and done!

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Black Forest Birthday Cake

name: Cadbury Chocolate Blueberry Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Cadbury Chocolate * Blueberry Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: DECADENT, DELICIOUS, DELIGHTFUL

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cocoa Powder, AP flour, baking powder, baking soda, caster sugar and salt.
Sift all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Mix well and set aside.
Measure the ingredients: buttermilk, coffee water, blueberries, vanilla extract and vegetable oil.
Mix the buttermilk, coffee (or water), vanilla extract and vegetable oil in another bowl. Whisk until well combined. Set aside.
Grease and line a 7-inch round pan with parchment paper. Set aside. Preheat oven to 180C.
Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture. Whisk until well combined. Lastly, add the fresh blueberries and fold gently. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for about 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the cake comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool for 5-10 minutes before taking it out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack.
Measure the ingredients for the ganache: Cadbury Choco Melts and warm fresh cream.
Pour warm cream over the Cadbury Choco Melts. Whisk well.
Wait for the ganache to cool down slightly and then pour it on the cooled cake. Spread gently.
Top with some fresh blueberries. Done!

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Cadbury Chocolate Blueberry Cake

name: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Choco Berry and * Mocha Bowl Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: CHOCO FILLED BOWLS OF DELIGHT

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for the dry mixture: Cadbury Cocoa Powder, AP Flour, baking powder and salt.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 1

steps.instructions: Sift the dry ingredients in a bowl. Mix well and set aside.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 2

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for the wet mixture: yogurt, caster sugar, baking soda, oil and vanilla extract.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 3

steps.instructions: Take another bowl and whisk the yogurt and baking soda in it. Let this mixture sit for 2 minutes until it gets bubbly. Then, add caster sugar, oil and vanilla extract. Whisk until well combined.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 4

steps.instructions: Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture. Whisk until well combined. Set aside.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 5

steps.instructions: Grease 3 bowls with oil and dust them with flour.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 6

steps.instructions: Pour the batter equally in the bowls. Preheat oven to 180C.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 7

steps.instructions: Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the cakes comes out clean. Let the cakes cool before demoulding.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 8

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for the Mocha filling: Cadbury Choco Melts, finely chopped strawberries, warm cream and coffee powder.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 9

steps.instructions: Pour warm cream over the Cadbury Choco Melts. Add in the coffee powder and whisk well. Add the finely chopped strawberries. Whisk well and set aside.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 10

steps.instructions: Dust a plate with Cadbury Cocoa Powder. Roll the edges of the cakes in the Cadbury Cocoa Powder.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 11

steps.instructions: Make a hole in the centre of each cake with a piping tip.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 12

steps.instructions: Fill the holes with the mocha filling. Set aside.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 13

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for the frosting: whipping cream and pink gel food colour.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 14

steps.instructions: Whip the cream in a chilled bowl until it forms stiff peaks. Add in the pink gel food colour. Whisk well and then transfer into a piping bag with a star tip nozzle.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 15

steps.instructions: Swirl the frosting on top of the cakes.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 16

steps.instructions: Your cakes are ready.

stepImage.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake Step 17

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl Cake

image.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl cake

thumbnail.alt: Choco Berry and Mocha Bowl cake

name: Cadbury Loaded Pinata Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Cadbury Loaded * Pinata Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: A MARVELLOUS SIGHT - A SCRUMPTIOUS DELIGHT

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cooking Block Dark.
Melt the Cadbury Cooking Block Dark in a pan. Stir continuously. Set aside.
Pour the melted chocolate into the Pinata mould and swirl it. Make sure the chocolate covers all the edges of the mould.
Pour off the excess chocolate and refrigerate for 10 minutes until the chocolate sets completely.
Once the chocolate sets, carefully peel the Pinata chocolate shell off the mould.
Dribble chocolate sauce on the shell and decorate with edible pearls. Set aside.
Measure the ingredients for the filling: Cadbury Oreo Dipped Cookies, Cadbury Dairy Milk Silk Caramello and Cadbury Gems.
Fill up your pinata cake - lay out the ingredients and cover with the Pinata shell.
When ready, break with hammer and enjoy!

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Cadbury Loaded Pinata Cake

name: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Gems and Caramello * Loaded Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: FOR THE HIGHS AND THE LOWS, GEMS AND CARAMELLO!

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: AP flour and baking powder.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 1

steps.instructions: Sift the dry ingredients in one bowl and set aside.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 2

steps.instructions: Grease and line an 8-inch round pan with parchment paper. Set aside.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 3

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Dairy Milk Caramello (chopped), vanilla extract, milk, caster sugar, eggs and butter.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 4

steps.instructions: Whisk the butter and caster sugar for 5 minutes.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 5

steps.instructions: Add the eggs, one at a time, and whisk again. Add the vanilla extract. Whisk until it becomes fluffy. Set aside.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 6

steps.instructions: Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients mixture. Whisk well. Add milk and whisk again. Add the chopped Cadbury Dairy Milk Caramello. Mix well and set it aside.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 7

steps.instructions: Pour the batter into the cake pan. Spread it gently. Set aside.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 8

steps.instructions: Preheat oven to 180C. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a skewer or tester inserted in the cake comes out clean.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 9

steps.instructions: Allow the cake to cool for 5-10 minutes before taking it out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 10

steps.instructions: Trim off the top of the cake if it is domed.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 11

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for the ganache: Cadbury Choco Melts, Cadbury Gems and fresh cream (warm).

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 12

steps.instructions: Pour warm cream over Cadbury Choco Melts and let it sit for 5 minutes. Stir until well combined.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 13

steps.instructions: Spread the ganache on the cake.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 14

steps.instructions: Decorate with Cadbury Gems and sprinkles.

stepImage.alt: Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake Step 15

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Gems and Caramello Loaded Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: SAY YES TO THE NUTTY GOODNESS!

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Cocoa Powder, AP flour, buttermilk, eggs, Cadbury Bournville (chopped), caster sugar, butter, baking powder, salt and vanilla extract.
Grease the bundt pan with melted butter and dust with flour. Set aside. Preheat oven to 160C.
Sift the Cadbury Cocoa Powder, AP flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl.
Whisk the butter and caster sugar for 6-7 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, and whisk. Keep repeating until all 4 eggs have been added. Keep whisking until the mixture becomes light and fluffy.
Add buttermilk and vanilla extract. Whisk until well blended. Set aside.
Add half the dry ingredients. Mix well. Add the other half. Mix well.
Add the Cadbury Bournville. Mix well.
Pour the batter into the pan. Fold gently. Set aside.
Bake for 50-55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the cake comes out clean.
Measure the ingredients for the ganache: warm Fresh cream and Cadbury Cooking Block Dark.
Pour warm cream over the Cadbury Cooking Block Dark. Let it sit for 5 minutes and then stir until combined. Set aside.
Measure the ingredients for the praline: caster sugar, toasted almonds and water.

Stir the sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until the sugar dissolves. Increase the heat and cook without stirring. Swirl the pan occasionally and brush down the sides with a wet pastry brush until the sugar turns amber in color. This should take 78 minutes.
Stir in the almonds. Pour on to a prepared sheet, separating the nuts. Let it cool for 5 minutes.
Break the candied nuts until they turn into uneven chunks.
Pour the ganache over the cooled bundt cake.
Garnish with almond praline.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Choco layers for Choco lovers

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: AP flour, caster sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt and Cadbury Cocoa Powder.
Sift all the dry ingredients in one bowl and set aside.
Measure the ingredients: egg, buttermilk, vegetable oil, coffee water and vanilla extract.
Mix the buttermilk, coffee water (or water), egg, vegetable oil and vanilla extract in another bowl. Mix well and set aside.
Grease and line two 6-inch round pans with parchment paper. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 180C.
Add the wet mixture to the dry, whisk until combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans.
Bake for about 30-35 minutes.
Insert a toothpick in the cakes to check if they are baked. Take the batter out.
Allow the cakes to cool for 5-10 minutes before taking them out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack.
Trim off the top of the cakes if they are domed. Set aside.
Measure the ingredients: chopped Cadbury Cooking Block Dark and warm fresh cream.
Pour the cream and the chopped Cadbury Cooking Block Dark in an induction vessel and let it sit for 5-10 minutes. Stir gently until well combined. Cool for 10 minutes.
Keep a cake board on the turntable, spread the ganache and then place one cake on it.
Spread another layer of ganache and place the other cake on it. Spread more ganache on the sides and top. Smoothen using a palette knife.
Decorate the cake however you like. Cool for 30 minutes and done!

name: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Choco and Bournville * Mud Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Scrumptious delight for the day and night

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Bournville, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, Cadbury Choco Melts, caster sugar, flour, baking powder, milk, fresh cream, curd, oil and vanilla essence.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 1

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Add the curd, milk, caster sugar, vanilla essence and oil. Whisk well.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 2

steps.instructions: Then add the sifted flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, baking powder and chopped Cadbury Bournville. Whisk well. Transfer the batter into a small glass/ceramic mug.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 3

steps.instructions: Microwave the cake for 1 minute and 30 seconds first, and then twice more for 30 seconds each.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 4

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for frosting: Cadbury Choco Melts and warm fresh cream.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 5

steps.instructions: Pour warm cream over the Cadbury Choco Melts and mix well until the chocolate melts. Frosting is ready!

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 6

steps.instructions: Once the cake is done, let it cool for 10 minutes.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 7

steps.instructions: Garnish using melted Cadbury Choco Melts and sprinkles.

stepImage.alt: Choco and Bournville Mud Cake Step 8

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Choco and Bournville Mud Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Tricky on the outside, treat on the inside

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients.
Sift all the dry ingredients in one bowl and set aside.
Grease and line 3 8-inch round pans with parchment paper. Set aside. Preheat oven to 180C.
Measure the ingredients.
Mix buttermilk, coffee (or water), eggs, oil, vanilla extract in another bowl. Mix until well combined.
Add the wet mixture to the dry, whisk till combined.
Lastly, add the roasted almonds & Cadbury Dairy Milk Silk and gently fold, do not over mix.
Pour 1/3rd of the batter into one of the prepared pans. Repeat twice.
Bake for about 30-35 mins. Insert a toothpick in the cake. If it comes out clean, the cake is baked. Take the batter out.
Allow the cake to cool for 5-10 mins before taking it out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack.
Trim off the top of the cake if it is domed. Repeat this twice.
Measure all the ingredients for frosting.
Whip the cream in a chilled bowl till it forms stiff peaks. Keep 1 1/2 cup of whipped cream aside in a piping bag.
Add orange food colouring to the leftover cream and mix well.
Measure the ingredients for decoration.
Pour fresh cream in a pan. Heat slightly. Add Cadbury Dairy Milk Silk and let it sit for 5 mins, then gently stir till combined.
Measure the ingredients for filling.Take a turntable and put some whipped cream on it. Place a cake board on the turntable and spread some of the orange whipped cream.
Add Cadbury Roasted Almonds Silk along with some roasted almonds. Place another layer of cake and repeat.
Add whipped cream for the last layer. Smoothen using a cake scraper.
Spread the chocolate ganache prepared earlier on top of the cake, use a spoon to create drips along the edges.
Pipe the whipped cream to make ghosts and use the melted chocolate to make eyes. Done!

name: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet * Anniversary Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: RED VELVET DELIGHT WITH CHOCO LOVE INSIDE

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: AP flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, salt, baking soda and oil.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 1

steps.instructions: Sift all the dry ingredients in one bowl and set aside.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 2

steps.instructions: Grease and line two 6-inch round pans with parchment paper. Set aside. Preheat oven to 180C.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 3

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: melted butter, vegetable oil, vinegar, red food colouring, eggs, vanilla extract, caster sugar and buttermilk.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 4

steps.instructions: Mix the butter and sugar in another bowl. Add the egg, vegetable oil, red food colouring, vanilla extract and vinegar. Mix well.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 5

steps.instructions: Add the dry mixture in two batches, alternate with 60 ml of buttermilk. Pour the remaining buttermilk on top. Mix until well blended.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 6

steps.instructions: Pour the batter into the prepared pans.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 7

steps.instructions: Bake for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the cakes comes out clean.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 8

steps.instructions: Allow the cakes to cool for 5-10 minutes.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 9

steps.instructions: Trim off the top of the cakes if they are domed.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 10

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: unsalted butter, icing sugar, Cadbury Red Velvet Silk and vanilla extract.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 11

steps.instructions: Take a bowl. Cream the butter for 5 minutes or until it becomes smooth and gets lighter in colour.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 12

steps.instructions: Sift the sugar in batches and mix well after each addition. Once done, add vanilla extract. Cream the mixture for 5 minutes until it is smooth and well blended.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 13

steps.instructions: Keep a cake board on the turntable. Put some buttercream on it. Place one cake on it and spread some buttercream on the cake. Add the chopped Cadbury Red Velvet Silk.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 14

steps.instructions: Place the other cake and spread buttercream on its sides and top. Smoothen using a palette knife.

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 15

steps.instructions: Decorate the cake with flowers or anything else you like. Done!

stepImage.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake Step 16

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For the Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake

image.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake

thumbnail.alt: Cadbury Silk Red Velvet Anniversary Cake

name: Diwali Pataka Choco Cake | Desserts Corner
title: Diwali Pataka Choco Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: The goodness of coconut in a chocolatey dessert

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: AP flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, desiccated coconut powder, baking powder & baking soda.
Sift all the dry ingredients in a bowl and set them aside.
Grease and line two 6-inch round pans with parchment paper. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 180C.
Measure the ingredients. Add melted butter, condensed milk, vanilla extract and water to another bowl. Whisk for 5 minutes.
Add the dry ingredients. Mix well.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans. Bake for about 30-35 mins.
Use a toothpick to check if it's baked. Take the cake out. Allow it to cool for 5-10 mins before taking it out of the pan, then cool on a wire rack. If domed, trim off the top of the cake.
Chop the Crispello and set aside.
For the frosting, beat the whipping cream with cocoa powder in a chilled bowl until you get stiff peaks.
Transfer 1/2 of the whipped cream to a piping bag with a star tipped nozzle.
Pour fresh cream in a pan. Heat slightly. Add the Cadbury Cooking Block Dark and let it sit for 5 minutes, then gently stir till combined.
Take a cake stand, place one cake on it. Add whipped cream using a spatula.
Place the other cake and smoothen the tops and the sides.
Pour the dark chocolate ganache on top. Use a spatula to make drips on the edges.
Pipe dollops of it along the edges.
Then add the Crispello and desiccated coconut on top for decoration.

ingredients.ingredientTitle: For Diwali Pataka Choco Coconut Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Fabulous, delicious, EASY!

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients - Cadbury Cocoa Powder, caster sugar, salt, cornstarch, whole milk, Cadbury Bournville, butter and vanilla extract.
In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar, cocoa powder, cornstarch and salt. Mix well.
Add milk gradually. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Add Bournville and stir the boiling mixture continuously for 2 minutes, until the chocolate melts. Keep stirring till the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat. Stir in butter and vanilla extract. Set aside.
Measure the ingredients: Cadbury Bournvita Biscuits, whipped cream and Cadbury Gems.
Add crushed Cadbury Bournvita Biscuits to each serving glass/dish.
Add the chocolate sauce to each serving glass/dish.
Keep chilled until serving.
Garnish with whipped cream and Cadbury Gems, if desired.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: THE NEXT BIG HIT, CAKE ON A STICK

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients: AP flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, baking soda, baking powder, caster sugar, salt and oil.
Sift all the dry ingredients in one bowl and set aside.
Grease and line an 8 inch round pan with parchment paper. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 180C.
Measure the wet ingredients: buttermilk, coffee water (or water), egg, oil and vanilla extract.
Add these wet ingredients to another bowl. Mix thoroughly.
Add the wet mixture to the dry and whisk till they're well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in it comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool for 5-10 minutes before taking it out of the pan. Then cool on a wire rack. Once it has cooled down completely, crumble it.
Measure the ingredients for the filling: Cadbury Red Velvet Silk, Cadbury Cooking Block Dark, whipped cream, crumbled cake.
Add the whipped cream to the crumbled cake. Mix well until the cake and cream are completely merged.
Melt the Cadbury Cooking Block Dark.
Take a cakesicle mould and pour the melted Cadbury Cooking Block Dark over it. Swirl it around till the chocolate covers all the edges and corners.
Push the ice cream stick in the mould opening. Do this for all the cakesicle cavities. Fill the mould with the crumbled cake filling and press it down.
Pour more melted chocolate to seal the Cakesicles. Put the cakesicle mould in the fridge for 10 minutes for the chocolate to set.
Carefully demould the Cakesicles. Drip the melted chocolate on the Cakesicles and sprinkle Cadbury Red Velvet Silk on top. Done!

name: Chocolate Cake Recipe - Make In Easy Steps | Desserts Corner
title: Chocolate * Sponge Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: It's a sponge. It's a cake. It's a Chocolate Sponge Cake!

steps.instructions: Grind all the ingredients into a smooth paste.
Add baking powder and mix well.
Pour the mixture in a greased pan.
Place the pan in the preheated pan with salt water on medium flame for 2025 mins.
Garnish with chocolate glaze and the cake is ready to serve.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Choco goodness, kheer we come!

steps.instructions: Heat a heavy bottom pan on medium heat, add ghee, rice, and crushed green cardamom pods.
Toss the rice with the ghee and cardamom for 2 minutes, stirring constantly until aromatic.
Add milk and stir well.
Boil on high flame for 8 minutes. Lower the heat to low and let the kheer cook for around 15minutes. Stir every 2 minutes or so.
Add Cadbury Dairy Milk Chocolates along with sugar. Stir well and allow the chocolate to melt.
Add chopped and roasted almonds and cashew nuts.
Stir in rose water and chill for an hour. To serve, garnish with fresh rose petals, chopped Cadbury Dairy Milk, and pistachios.

items.label: basmati rice, rinsed and soaked in water for 30 minutes

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: A classic made a lot more delicious with a little less

steps.instructions: Measure all the ingredients.
Take a heat proof bowl, and measure out the Cadbury Choco Block in it. Then chop the block into smaller pieces.
Using a double boiler, melt the Choco Blocks and butter over low-mid heat. It will take 4-5 minutes to melt.
Take it out and mix until the mixture is uniform. Let it cool. Then, add the salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs using the electric whisk for 7-8 minutes or until it doubles in volume. Meanwhile, preheat your oven at 170C for 10 minutes.
Fold the Choco Block mixture into the whipped eggs, only till it's just combined.
Line an 8-inch cake tin, with parchment paper and pour the combined mixture in it.
Bake it for 25 to 30 minutes, and serve it warm or cold!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Your favourite cake and swirl moulded in a cup shaped delight

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients.
Preheat the oven to 180C. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 2 liners (this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes). Set aside.
Sift the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl until thoroughly combined. Set aside.
Measure all the other ingredients.
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, granulated sugar, brown sugar, oil, and vanilla together until combined.

Pour half of the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add half of the buttermilk. Gently whisk for a few seconds. Stir until just combined; do not overmix. The batter will be thin. Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients & buttermilk.
Pour or spoon the batter into the liners. Pour only halfway through to avoid spilling over the sides or sinking.
Bake for 18 to 21 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before frosting.
For the frosting, heat the cream, till it's first boil and pour it into the bowl of Cadbury Choco Melts. Cover and leave it for 15 minutes in the refridgerator.
Take it out, and whisk for 5 minutes, until the ganache becomes light and fluffy.
Transfer into a piping bag. Frost the cupcakes, once they are cooled down.
Serve it!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Strawberry swirl and a chocolatey twirl combine for this delicious whirl

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for topping.
In a bowl, pit the cherries and add sugar and lime juice. Mix and leave it for 20 minutes in the refrigerator.
Line a 7x7 baking dish with baking paper and coat it with butter. Set aside.
Chop Cadbury Choco Block and set it aside.
Measure the ingredients for batter.
In a medium pan, combine the Cadbury Choco Block and butter, and melt over medium-low heat, stirring constantly. Once melted, remove the pan from the heat immediately.
After that, add brown sugar and granulated sugar and mix it well.
Measure the rest.
Add Vanilla extract, AP flour and Sea salt. Whisk all together.
Preheat oven to 180 C while you pour the batter into the prepared pan. Add the macerated cherries on top.
Bake the brownies for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted 2- inches from the side comes out clean. Let the brownies cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares.
Your delicious brownies are ready!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Make your Cookies doubly delicious

steps.instructions: Measure all the ingredients.
In a bowl, beat the butter and castor sugar until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Add egg and mix well.
In the same bowl, add flour and baking soda. Mix well to combine the dry and the wet ingredients. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of milk if the dough is too dry.
Then, add the Cadbury Choco Blocks and Cadbury Choco Chips. Refrigerate the cookie dough for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 180C and line the baking tray with parchment paper/ silicon mat. Use a mini ice-cream scoop to transfer the dough on the baking tray, in the shape of balls.
Press them lightly with your fingers and place Cadbury Choco Chips/Block on top.
Bake the cookies at 180C for 10 minutes until the edges of the cookies are golden-brown. Let the cookies rest on the baking tray for another 10 minutes (outside the oven) before you lift them.
Your cookies are ready.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Add a chocolatey crunch to your favourite choco sprinkled pancakes!

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients.
In a clean bowl, sift, flour, baking powder and salt. Then, keep it aside
Measure the rest.
In a separate bowl, add milk, melted butter and egg.
Then, add sugar, the sifted flour mixture and the Cadbury Choco Chips. Whisk it all together until well combined.
Cover and leave the mixture for 15 minutes.
Heat a nonstick pan and add tbsp of butter. Once the butter melts, pour a scoop of batter in the pan.
Let it cook for 4 minutes at low heat. Once there are small bubbles on the surface, flip it carefully and cook for another 3 minutes. Remove it from the pan once both sides are nicely golden brown.
Cook the rest of the pancakes, and serve it with melted Cadbury Choco Melts and whipped cream.

name: Choco Melts Cinnamon Mousse | Desserts Corner
title: Choco Melts * Cinnamon Mousse

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Fresher than fresh from the oven with its bold cinnamon twist

steps.instructions: Measure all the ingredients
Take a heat proof bowl, and put the Cadbury Choco Melts in it.
Using a double boiler, melt the Cadbury Choco Melts over low-mid heat. It will take 4 to 5 minutes to melt.
Once melted, take the bowl out. Add cinnamon powder and salt.
Meanwhile take a clean bowl and whip the chilled heavy cream, for 8 to 10 minutes or until firm peaks are formed.
Fold in the melted Cadbury Choco Melts, with whipped cream until the mixture looks light and airy.
Then, pipe it in the serving glass, and freeze for 10 minutes. Serve this delicious and airy mousse chilled.

ingredients.ingredientTitle: FOR THE CHOCO MELTS CINNAMON MOUSSE

name: Choco Melts Mug cake | Desserts Corner
title: Choco Melts Mug Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Cozy chocolatey hug snug in a mug

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients.
In a ceramic or borosilicate cup, add flour, baking powder and a pinch of salt and keep it aside.
Using a double boiler, melt the Cadbury Choco Melts over low-mid heat. It will take 4 to 5 minutes to melt.
Measure the ingredients to be added.
Melt the butter separately, and add it to the dry mixture.
Add some Cadbury Choco Chips, sugar, milk and vanilla essence. Mix it well, using the whisk.
Then, add melted Cadbury Choco Melts. Mix well. Add few melts on top. Place your cup in the microwave for a minute. The cake would double in size.
Serve it warm, and enjoy this delicious cake with your friends and family!

ingredients.ingredientTitle: FOR THE CHOCO MELTS MUG CAKE

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Raise your cup to a delicious little piece of cheese smeared heaven

steps.instructions: Measure the ingredients for biscuit base
For biscuit base: Grind the Oreo Biscuits with Cadbury Choco Chips after adding the melted butter. Set it aside.
Combine them well and transfer the mixture to the cupcake pan. Press it down to the base of each cupcake mould.
Refrigerate the crust for 10 minutes.
Measure the rest of the ingredients.
In another bowl, whisk softened cream cheese and condensed milk, then add melted Choco Block.
Whisk again, and add heavy cream and whip. Add the lime juice and corn flour. Combine the mixture well.
Preheat your oven for 10 minutes at 160C. Then, pour the cheesecake mixture into the cupcake liners.
Bake the cheesecake at 160C for 35 to 40 minutes or until the filling starts to set. The centre might seem wobbly, but it will continue to cook as the cheesecake cools.
Once the cheesecake is baked, allow it to come to room temperature.
Refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 2 hours before unmoulding. Your Cheesecake Cups are ready!

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Shake up your summer plans with this refreshing delight using Cadbury Oreo Milkshake mix.

steps.instructions: Measure all ingredients
Put vanilla ice cream, milk & cocoa powder in a blender
Add Oreo milkshake mix in the blender along with vanilla essence
Blend everything together until smooth and creamy
Oreo Milkshake is ready to serve

items.label: Cold milk (Full fat milk is ideal)

name: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate | Desserts Corner
title: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Try this warm indulgent drink using Cadbury Hot Chocolate - your perfect companion for a rainy day.

steps.instructions: Measure all the ingredients.

stepImage.alt: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate Step 1

steps.instructions: In a vessel, pour some milk and sugar, and start heating it at low heat.

stepImage.alt: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate Step 2

steps.instructions: Add the Cadbury Hot Chocolate Powder, some cinnamon, ginger to the vessel. Make sure everything is well dissolved.

stepImage.alt: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate Step 3

steps.instructions: Continue heating the milk for 5-8 mins., till it thickens. Then, switch off the flame.

stepImage.alt: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate Step 4

steps.instructions: If you like a thicker consistency of hot chocolate, you can add another tbsp. of the Cadbury Hot Chocolate Powder. Otherwise, remove the vessel from heat.

stepImage.alt: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate Step 5

steps.instructions: Serve it warm for a cozy rainy season sip.

stepImage.alt: Ginger and Cinnamon Hot Chocolate Step 6

name: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate | Desserts Corner
title: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: A citrusy hot chocolate recipe, with a thicker consistency. And Banana helps increasing immunity, so a great recipe for the rainy season.

steps.instructions: Measure all the ingredients

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 1

steps.instructions: Take 1/2 cup of milk, add half a banana - cut into pieces, and puree it to form semi-thick banana milk

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 2

steps.instructions: Then, strain it to remove any banana pieces

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 3

steps.instructions: Pour the rest of the milk with the banana milk into a vessel

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 4

steps.instructions: Add sugar to the vessel and start heating it

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 5

steps.instructions: Now, add Cadbury Hot Chocolate Powder and some orange zest. Combine everything with a ladle or a spatula

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 6

steps.instructions: Continue heating everything on a medium heat for 5 mins, or until the hot chocolate thickens

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 7

steps.instructions: Your Banana and Orange zest hot chocolate is ready to be served

stepImage.alt: Banana & Orange Zest Hot Chocolate Step 8

image.alt: banana and orange zest hot chocolate

thumbnail.alt: banana and orange zest hot chocolate

name: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake | Desserts Corner
title: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Shake up your frothy milkshake recipe with crushed oreos and nutmeg for that extra bite.

steps.instructions: Measure all the ingredients

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 1

steps.instructions: In a mixer jar, add cold milk, some ice cubes and milkshake powder

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 2

steps.instructions: Grind everything. Then, add peanut butter and nutmeg

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 3

steps.instructions: Grind everything again

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 4

steps.instructions: Take a glass and pour in the chilled milkshake

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 5

steps.instructions: Dust it with nutmeg powder and garnish with crushed Oreos on top

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 6

steps.instructions: Enjoy your thick creamy milkshake

stepImage.alt: Peanut Butter and Nutmeg Oreo Milkshake Step 7

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Made deliciously smooth for the indulgent sweet tooth

steps.instructions: Crush the Oreo cookies.
Add 1/2 cup crushed Oreos to the chopped and frozen fruits in a mixer.
Add milk & vanilla essence.
Grind until smooth. Pour the mixture into a bowl.
Top with sliced Bananas, add sliced strawberries, sliced almonds, crushed Oreo, and Enjoy.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Orange with a shade of natures green

steps.instructions: Peel and chop the cucumber & ginger
Then, in a blender, add spinach, Tang Orange, cucumber and ginger
Put everything through the blender
Strain the juice for a better texture
The Tang Orange Evergreen is ready to be served

items.label: a pinch of salt & lemon for taste

name: Tang Lemon Breeze Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Tang Lemon Breeze

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Breeze through your summer blues

steps.instructions: Peel and slice the cucumber
In a jar, add honey, mint leaves, cucumber slices & black pepper powder
Then, add Tang Lemon & some water to it
Just blend all the ingredients, and you are ready to serve

items.label: a pinch of black pepper powder

name: Tang Orange Juice Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Tang Orange Twister

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: A refreshing mix with a charming twist

steps.instructions: In a jar, add some cocunut water, lemon juice and mint leaves
Then, add Tang Orange to it
Blend all the ingredients
And you are ready to serve

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Nothing captures summer like mangoes and ice creams

steps.instructions: Refrigerate all-purpose cream for 2-3 hours
Mix two spoons of Tang Mango with four spoons of cream
Beat it with a whisk until it is foamy
Fill a glass up to three quarters with milk and ice cubes
Lay the foamy cream over it, and the Tang Mango Dalgona is ready to be served

name: Chocolate Pizza  Easy & Delicious Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Oreo Pizza

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Two cultural icons, one universal love

steps.instructions: Crush the Oreo Cookies.
Cut the dark chocolate into pieces.
Add butter and sugar to the dark chocolate and microwave for 20s at a time till the ganache is smooth.
Mix the all purpose flour, powdered sugar, baking soda, baking powder and Cadbury Cocoa Powder and seive well.
Add the powdered mixture to the dark chocolate ganache.
Add 2 cups of crushed Oreo cookies and mix well.
Add milk and mix until smooth.
Spread the mixture evenly on a flat plate.
Bake at 170 deg celsius for 25 minutes to form the pizza base.
Add 1/2 cup powdered sugar to cream cheese and mix until smooth.
Add 1 tsp vanilla extract to the cram cheese mixture and blend.
Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly on the baked pizza base.
Add crushed Oreo cookies on top of the cream cheese layer as toppings.
Slice the pizza. Drizzle chocolate sauce over the slices and enjoy.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: The perfect excuse for breakfast all day

steps.instructions: Mix melted butter, fresh cream and warm milk in a bowl
Whisk until smooth
Add sugar to this mixture and mix
Add flour, baking powder
Add 6-7 crushed Oreo cookies. Whisk well
Add 1 tsp vanilla essence and fold. Grease the waffle maker with melted butter
Pour the prepared mixture into the mould and spread evenly.
Cook evenly from both sides
Top with vanilla Ice cream
Add chocolate sauce
Garnish with crushed Oreos & enjoy

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Easy treats for every occasion

steps.instructions: Crush the Oreo cookies.
Break white chocolate into pieces.
Add condensed milk and stir until melted & smooth.
Add 3/4th of the crushed Oreo cookies to the mixture and mix well.
Spread the mixture evenly on a lined tin.
Set mixture in fridge overnight.
Cut the set Oreo Fudge into cubes to enjoy

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Crunchy like Oreos, soft like brownies. The best of both worlds in a chocolaty mix

steps.instructions: Take Cadbury Milk Baking Chocolate and butter in a pan and melt it on low heat.
Finely chop Oreo cookies.
Pour the baking chocolate and butter mixture in a bowl. Add castor sugar and mix itwell.
Add eggs in the batter and whisk it.
Then add self-raising flour and Cadbury Bournville Cocoa through a strainer.
Add the chopped Oreo cookies and mix the batter well.
Take a greased and paper lined pan (28 x 18cm) and pour the batter in it. Place full Oreo cookies in the batter and bake it at 170C for 40-45 mins or until cooked.

name: Best Choco Lava Cake Recipe To Make At Home | Desserts Corner
title: Gooey Choco * Lava Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Unbelievably rich. You'll wish you lava' nother one

steps.instructions: Mix all the wet and dry ingredients together along with the Cadbury Cocoa Powder.
Whisk it well and pour the batter into greased muffin cups. Gently press the chocolate squares into the batter till they're immersed.
Bake at 180C for 30 minutes.
Dust the cakes with Cadbury Cocoa and serve!

name: Hot Chocolate Bombs Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Hot Chocolate * Bomb Explosion

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Hot luxury festive choco bombs

steps.instructions: For the hot chocolate: heat the cream, milk and sugar. Bring to a boil and add Cadbury Hot Chocolate powder.
For the spheres, take the mould and apply chocolate on the sides. Make about 6 half-spheres. Once chilled, remove from the mould and keep refrigerated.
Now take one half and add 2 tsp of all the filling ingredients.
Take the other half and stick them together to form the sphere.
Garnish the spheres with some white chocolate lines. Let it chill in the fridge.
To serve, place the chocolate sphere in the glass and pour the hot chocolate on top of it. Stir well and serve.

items.label: melted chocolate (to achieve the sphere effect)

name: Eggless Chocolate Mousse Cake Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Easy Eggless * Mousse Cake

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: A thrilling mousse chase that's delicious too

steps.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a mixing bowl and strain into a cooking pan.
Stir ingredients in a cooking pan.
Transfer in a mould lined with butter paper and refrigerate for 8-10 hours.
Generously dust the cake with Cadbury cocoa powder and serve in thick slices.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Fun and chocolate wrapped in a delicious ball

steps.instructions: Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat.
Add Cadbury Cocoa Powder; stir until smooth.
Add sweetened condensed milk; increase heat to medium. Cook, and stir constantly for about 4 minutes or until mixture is smooth and glossy with a pudding-like consistency.
Remove from heat; stir. Cover; refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours or until firm.
Shape into 1-1/4-inch balls; roll in Cadbury Cocoa Powder or powdered sugar.
Refrigerate until firm, 1 to 2 hours. Cover it and store in the refrigerator.

name: Chocolate Tart Recipe To Make At Home | Desserts Corner
title: Rich Chocolate * Tart

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Delicious to eat and so pretty to look at

steps.instructions: In a bowl, add water, castor sugar, salt and mix well.
In a mixing bowl, add unsalted butter and whisk it well.
Add all-purpose flour in batches and mix well.
Then, add Cadbury cocoa powder and mix well.
Now, add the prepared sugar mixture and mix it well to make a thick batter.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove it from the refrigerator and take a ball of dough and dust itwith flour.
Flatten it with the help of a rolling pin.
Place the dough in the tart moulder and remove the excess dough from it. Prick the dough with the help of a fork. Preheat the oven to 300F/150C. Bake for about 15 minutes. Re-mould the tart from it.
Take a deep pan and fill half with water. Place a bowl on top of it. Add Cadbury Bournville in a medium bowl. Add melted butter, fresh cream and mixit well or until the chocolate is melted.
Fill it with the prepared chocolate ganache and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Remove it from refrigerator.
Decorate it with white chocolate ganache, pistachios, whipped chocolate ganache and dried cranberries.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: This flavourful traditional treat has new flavours to boast

steps.instructions: Mix chenna and sugar and knead till smooth.
Heat a heavy-bottom or nonstick pan. Add the ghee and the paneer mixture. Cook on low flame. Stir continuously.
Melt the Cadbury chocolate in a double-boiler or in a microwave.
Add to the chenna mixture. Cook till the mixture leaves the sides and comes together like dough. Remove from heat.
Knead again till its smooth or blend in a blender.
Break the dough into small balls. Shape them with a mould or press gently into shape with hands, and place pistachios in the middle.
Your Cadbury Choco-Sandesh is ready.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Pour a little chocolate over your festive treats

steps.instructions: For outer coating, melt Cadbury Dairy Milk in a pot and keep aside in a bowl.
For Modak, in a non-stick pan, take desiccated coconut, milk powder, milk, and sugar, and cook the mix for 4 minutes.
Now add Cadbury Dairy Milk and Cadbury 5 Star and stir till the chocolate bars have melted. Cook this for 2 minutes till the entire mixture starts separating around the sides of the pan.
Let it cool down completely. Now take a modak mould and press the mixture into it. - Unmould it and repeat the process till you have used up all the mixture.
Now dip the modaks we made using a dipping fork in the bowl with melted Cadbury Dairy Milk.Allow it to set at room temperature for 10 minutes.
And there you have it! Cadbury Celebrations Choco Modaks are ready.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Tasty all round. Sweet from every angle

steps.instructions: Take a saucepan, add cream and condensed milk, and warm the mixture.
Add coconut powder and cardamom powder and mix it.
Make small laddoos as per the size you want and refrigerate it for 15 to 20 mins.
Take a bowl, add Cadbury chocolate, and melt it in a double-boiler.
Dip the laddoos in melted Cadbury chocolate and put crushed Gems on top.

name: Chocolate Fudge  4 Ingredients Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Nutty Delish * Chocolate Fudge

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: No such thing as too much fudge. Delightful and chocolaty

steps.instructions: Take a pan, add condensed milk, Cadbury Cocoa Powder and mix it well.
Cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat. Add butter and mix it well.
Then, add crushed walnuts and almonds and mix it well. Cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat.
Remove it from heat. Transfer this into a tray and spread it evenly.
Add some crushed walnuts and almonds on it. Refrigerate for 2 hours.
Cut it into pieces and serve.

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: The nation's sweetheart goes international

steps.instructions: Heat a non-stick pan on medium heat.
Add butter, cashews, sugar, Cadbury Cocoa Powder and condensed milk. Stir to combine.
Continue stirring and cook the mixture on medium-low heat for 10 mins, or till it's done.
Transfer to a greased mould and cool for 10 mins.
Cut into squares and cool further for 30 mins.

items.label: cashew nuts cut into small pieces

name: Choco Lava Brownie Recipe | Desserts Corner
title: Yummy Choco * Lava Brownie

decorativeArrowIllustration.title: For measuring\nthe ingredients
decorativeArrowIllustration.content: Brownies to cure your frownies. And of course, Chocolate!

steps.instructions: In a bowl, add butter, oil, curd, sugar and vanilla extract.
Whisk until smooth and set aside.
In a bowl, sift all purpose flour, Cadbury Cocoa Powder, salt, baking powder and mix well with a spatula.
Add in the wet mix into the bowl and combine using a spatula till you get a good consistency.
Pour half the batter onto a baking dish. Layer it with pieces of Cadbury Dairy Milk and pour in the rest of the batter. Sprinkle chocolate chips over the batter.
Cook in a pan or pressure cooker for 35 minutes.
Dig in and enjoy.
